instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
hi i have <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> before i open the macbook was can on and can charge.
the main problem is when turning on after few seconds
can see the apple logo then suddenly shutdowns then
on automatically then shutdowns again, sometimes u need to turn on again.

found small corroded parts <RESISTOR>R5481</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5482</RESISTOR>
also pin 7 8 <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> after i clean this part (no parts from here damage)

now no green light but still can on with high fan with battery

no smc bypass mode on charger, on battery yes

testing on charger orig 65watts without battery
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0.0V

<CHIP>U6900</CHIP>
pin 5 0.0V traces goin to j6900 pin5 is ok
pin 4 0.0V
pin 0.0V

checked and change dcin board and <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> still no green light

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
resistance between 17-18 3.2 ohms
28-28 20.3 ohms

voltages:
1 15V
2. 16.4v
3. 3.8v
9. 0.0V
12. 3.4v
13. 3.4v
14. 0.0V
15. 0.0V
17. 0.0V
19. 0.0v
20. 0.0V
27. 15.7V

"19. 0.0v
20. 0.0V"
Check diode mode to ground.
If good change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
Do you get 12MHz at Y5010?
Post its DC voltages, if you don't have o-scope, or frequency meter.

Did you try known good DCIN board?
Post <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> voltages.

Check voltage and diode mode at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
If something strange, disconnect BIL and test again.

Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>?

Y5010

<SIGNAL>SMC_EXTAL</SIGNAL> 1.1v stable using osci MHz is looping from random 1-2-4-40MHz
